symbols.name: jQuery.sap.support
symbols.description:
The jQuery.sap.support namespace is the central entry point for the Support Assistant functionality.

Overview

jQuery.sap.support reveals an API for the Support Assistant which you can easily work with to analyze an application.

Usage

  • jQuery.sap.support.addRule method allows adding a new rule.
  • jQuery.sap.support.analyze starts the analysis of the application.
  • Then the result can be accessed with methods jQuery.sap.support.getAnalysisHistory, jQuery.sap.support.getLastAnalysisHistory or jQuery.sap.support.getFormattedAnalysisHistory.
For more information, see {@link topic:a34eb58aaf124f538a3ead23a6cab04a Support Assistant API}.

methods.name: addRule

returnValue.description: Rule creation status. Possible values are "success" or description of why adding failed.

parameters.name: oRule
parameters.description: Settings for the new rule. For detailed information about its properties see {@link topic:eaeea19a991d46f29e6d8d8827317d0e Rule Property Values}

methods.description: Adds new temporary rule when in silent mode

methods.name: analyze

returnValue.description: Notifies the finished state by starting the Analyzer

parameters.name: oExecutionScope

parentId.name: parentId
parentId.description: ID of the root element that forms a subtree. Use when the scope is not global.

parameters.description: The execution scope of the analysis (see {@link topic:e15067d976f24b11907f4c262bd749a0 Execution Scopes}).

parameters.name: vPresetOrRules
parameters.description:
This optional parameter allows for selection of subset of rules for the analysis. You can pass:
  • A rule preset object containing the preset ID and the list of rules it contains.
  • A string that refers to the ID of a system preset.
  • An object array with a plain list of rules.

methods.description:
Main method to perform analysis of a given running application.

Allows to choose a particular execution scope - desired part of the UI to be checked and a flexible way to specify the list of rules to be used.

methods.name: getAnalysisHistory

returnValue.description: Array of history objects in the order of analyses performed. The results of the last analysis are contained in the last element in the array.

methods.description: Returns the history of all executed analyses.

methods.name: getFormattedAnalysisHistory

returnValue.description: All analysis history objects in the correct format.

parameters.name: sFormat
parameters.description: The format into which the history object will be converted. Possible values are listed in sap.ui.support.HistoryFormats.

methods.description: Returns the history of all executed analyses into formatted output depending on the passed format.

methods.name: getLastAnalysisHistory
methods.description: Returns the result of the last analysis performed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.support
symbols.description:
UI5 library: sap.ui.support. A library for the Support Assistant tool.

Overview

The library provides the Support Assistant tool. It enables application developers to check whether their applications are built according to the best practices for building SAPUI5 apps. The tool uses a set of pre-defined rules to check all aspects of an application.

properties.name: WCBChannels
properties.description:
Overview

These channels enable the user to hook to the {@link sap.ui.support.WindowCommunicationBus }

Usage

These channels are used for communication with Main.

symbols.name: sap.ui.support.AnalysisResult
symbols.description: Analysis result which is created after analysis with the SupportAssistant.

properties.name: analysisMetadata
properties.description: The metadata provided in the analyze method, if any.

properties.name: applicationInfo
properties.description: Array with information about the application.

properties.name: totalIssuesCount
properties.description: Count of the issues, found in the application.

properties.name: issues
properties.description: Array with all the issues, which were found.

symbols.name: sap.ui.support.ExecutionScope
symbols.description:
Allows to select the scope of analysis on an application.

Overview

ExecutionScope is the third parameter of a rule check function. It provides access to internal UI5 objects available for inspection. The getElements API method allows the user to select a specific subset of elements valid for their case. It accepts one query object argument.

Usage

When a rule is executed, three parameters are passed: oIssueManager, oCoreFacade and oScope. An ExecutionScope instance is passed to every call of a rule check function. When you analyze your application, available objects are collected depending on the settings passed to the Support Assistant at the moment when you start it.

type.name: type
type.description: Type name to filter by type

public.name: public
public.description: Option to exclude elements that are not public aggregations

cloned.name: cloned
cloned.description: Option to exclude elements that are clones of list bindings

methods.name: getElementsByClassName

parameters.name: classNameSelector
parameters.description: Either string or function to be used when selecting a subset of elements

methods.description: Gets elements by their type

methods.name: getLoggedObjects
methods.description: Gets the logged objects by object type

methods.name: getPublicElements
methods.description: Returns all public elements, i.e. elements that are part of public API aggregations

methods.name: getType

returnValue.description: The type of the execution scope. Possible values are global, subtree or components.

methods.description: Gets the type of the execution scope

symbols.name: sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer
symbols.description:
The sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer namespace is the central entry point for the Support Assistant functionality.

Overview

sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer reveals an API for the Support Assistant which you can easily work with to analyze an application.

Usage

  • sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer.addRule method allows adding a new rule.
  • sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer.analyze starts the analysis of the application.
  • Then the result can be accessed with methods sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer.getAnalysisHistory, sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer.getLastAnalysisHistory or sap.ui.support.RuleAnalyzer.getFormattedAnalysisHistory.
For more information, see {@link topic:a34eb58aaf124f538a3ead23a6cab04a Support Assistant API}.

methods.name: addRule

returnValue.description: Rule creation status. Possible values are "success" or description of why adding failed.

parameters.name: oRule
parameters.description: Settings for the new rule. For detailed information about its properties see {@link topic:eaeea19a991d46f29e6d8d8827317d0e Rule Property Values}

methods.description: Adds new temporary rule when in silent mode

methods.name: analyze

returnValue.description: Notifies the finished state by starting the Analyzer

parameters.name: oExecutionScope

parentId.name: parentId
parentId.description: ID of the root element that forms a subtree. Use when the scope type is subtree.

components.name: components
components.description: List of IDs of the components to be analyzed. Use only when the scope type is components.

parameters.description: The execution scope of the analysis (see {@link topic:e15067d976f24b11907f4c262bd749a0 Execution Scope}).

parameters.name: vPresetOrRules
parameters.description:
This optional parameter allows for selection of subset of rules for the analysis. You can pass:
  • A rule preset object containing the preset ID and the list of rules it contains.
  • A string that refers to the ID of a system preset.
  • An object array with a plain list of rules.

parameters.name: oMetadata
parameters.description: Metadata in custom format. Its only purpose is to be included in the analysis report.

methods.description:
Main method to perform analysis of a given running application.

Allows to choose a particular execution scope - desired part of the UI to be checked and a flexible way to specify the list of rules to be used.

methods.name: getAnalysisHistory

returnValue.description: Array of history objects in the order of analyses performed. The results of the last analysis are contained in the last element in the array.

methods.description: Returns the history of all executed analyses.

methods.name: getFormattedAnalysisHistory

returnValue.description: All analysis history objects in the correct format.

parameters.name: sFormat
parameters.description: The format into which the history object will be converted. Possible values are listed in sap.ui.support.HistoryFormats.

methods.description: Returns the history of all executed analyses into formatted output depending on the passed format.

methods.name: getLastAnalysisHistory
methods.description: Returns the result of the last analysis performed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.support.RuleSet
symbols.description:
Creates a RuleSet. The RuleSet can store multiple rules concerning namespaces.

Usage

The RuleSet is an interface used to create, update and delete rulesets.

methods.name: addRule
methods.description: Adds rules to RuleSet.

methods.name: clearAllRuleSets
methods.description: Clears all rulesets inside the RuleSet.

methods.name: getRules

returnValue.description: All rules within the current RuleSet

methods.description: Gets all rules from the RuleSet.

methods.name: loadSelectionOfRules

parameters.name: aLibraries
parameters.description: The current loaded libraries and their rules

methods.description: Loads the previous selection of the user - which rules are selected to be run by the Rule Analyzer. The method applies the settings to the currently loaded rules.

methods.name: removeRule

parameters.name: oRule
parameters.description: Rule object that will be removed

methods.description: Remove rule from RuleSet.

methods.name: storeSelectionOfRules

parameters.name: aLibraries
parameters.description: The data for the libraries and their rules

methods.description: Stores which rules are selected to be run by the analyzer on the next check

methods.name: updateRule
methods.description: Updates rules from the RuleSet.
